title: Is the length of 700 words okay for a Wattpad book chapter? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on the kind of book. Depends on the genre. Depends on where you are at writing in the book. Depends on how much of an experienced writer you are. Depends on how man readers and what kind you have. Many books have 500 word chapters and that is okay. However, many readers do not like short chapters and prefer them in between 1000 and 2500 - 3000 words. That is not always the case. But, all in all, it is your book. Write what you feel is neccessary. Just do not go from a 700 word chapter to a 3000 word chapter. If you feel that the chapter is over, then just stop and write the next fchapter. If later on you want to make your chapters longer, slowly increase the amount. E.g: Chapter 1: 700, Chapter 2: 800, Chapter 3: 1000, Chapter 4: 1200, Chapter 5: 1200, Chapter 6: 1500. Don’t make it too obvious that your increasing the word limit. Not that it’s a bad thing, but readers shouldn’t be noticing the word count if your book is really good. In conclusion, yes 700 words is enough.

IT DEPENDS on Genre.generally most of the authors try to write at least 1000 words for each chapter… better target at least 2000 words for a chapter if you want to become a professional writer. most of the professional writers try to write 2k to 3k words per chapter… I don't think we can be descriptive in 700 words in a chapter… if you are writing for yourself then it's up to you…

It depends on your book and the genre. If it's a fanfic then yes. If it's a book you plan on publishing then probably not. Also your target audience matters. If you are writing an adult erotica book then you might put more words then a lighthearted fanfic.
That is depending on the story genre and the audience who'll read the story. Some fanfics can work well, others can't. Don't forget the storyline too.
